Let's Talk About the incredibly sexy Topic of Tax Reform if You're in Public trying to Keep it Calm Down There mmm
Deductions and Dirty Dirty Tax rates Obviously I'm Joking it's not A sexy Topic but it Is
Incredibly Important and These Would be massive Changes so what am I talking about Whether the republicans Revealed Their Unified
Framework Which Is Their guide for the new Simplified Tax Code the last Tax Reform occurred in
1986 it is extremely Complex so let's Talk about some of These Specific
Changes Because Right Now You just have A lot of People Saying like this is the worst Thing ever This is the Best Thing ever
What does it do?
Well Let's start With Individual Taxes is going to Affect the largest Group of People this reform calls for Reduced
Individual Income Tax Rates Currently for Individual rates There Are seven Tiers and Here They are Proposing Just
312 Percent of 25 Percent and A 35% Additionally the Framework
Also allows for an Optional Fourth Tier to be Added above
35% so other Than Simplification what does this Mean on the high and low end well the low end the current Bottom tier Is
10% so this is Technically a raise in
Taxes On the lowest you're Taking that 10 Percent Tax rate you're Bumping it up to 12% but that's not the end of the story
And we're Gonna Touch on this again on the high end The current highest here Is Thirty nine Point Six Percent so we're Actually Seeing
A reduction here Unless that Fourth tier Is at the Framework
Also calls for an Increased Standard Deduction Standard Deduction is a specific amount of Income that Is not Taxed this Is an Alternate to
Itemizing Deductions and I'm Losing you
Nothing Get someone's Eyes To glaze Over like Itemized Deduction Main Point
Is it's an Amount of Money that Is not Taxed for an Individual or a married couple or they're Calling for Is doubling the current
Number so that Would Make twelve Thousand Dollars A year for an Individual and Twenty Four Thousand for a married couple
Beneficial to Everyone This Could, also Technically Create a Zero Percent Tax Bracket for an Individual or a couple that Makes
Less than Those Amounts that is A big Deal Because
Essentially by Doubling The deductibles They're Doubling The Zero Percent Tax Bracket that's not being Included here They
Also Call for an Increase to the Child Tax Credit right now You get a thousand Dollar Credit for Every Kid you have under 17
There's no Specific Amount or multiplier mentioned it Just Says Substantial it
Also proposes Opening up the Eligibility requirements so more People Can, Qualify Can
We see the proposal of getting Rid of Some Deductions One of Their Goals Here is to Simplify?
Taxes and That Means Cutting Most Itemized Deductions that includes Things like State and Local Tax Deductions
Also Eliminating personal Exemptions that Could be Worth Four Thousand Fifty Dollars per Person but it does Call for Keeping Tax incentives for Homeownership
Retirement Savings Charitable Giving Higher Education They
Also Call for the removal of the alternative Minimum Tax the estate Tax Which you might Have heard of as the Death Tax
Also to clear Up any of the Confusion Around Death Tax This is something that Really only affects the very Wealthy when someone dies and
Everything They Have is transferred to Their heir There is a Tax if the Cash the real Estate That everything Exceeds Five Point four nine
Million Dollars Nice per Person if his Grandma and Grandpa's Stuff you Just you double that so because of that high Dollar Amount
estimates Say This doesn't Affect 99
Point eight Percent of The Estates in America then
